item.title: Attraction
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: As always, this comic is the briefest of introductions to the concept of what attraction can be, the different ways it can manifest, and how one can label it— and there are many different points of view out there! There’s so much more to learn about attraction, sexual orientation, identity labels, relationship models, and, you […]
item.content:encoded:
Attraction

by Erika Moen on 07/07/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Sex & Sexuality

As always, this comic is the briefest of introductions to the concept of what attraction can be, the different ways it can manifest, and how one can label it— and there are many different points of view out there! There’s so much more to learn about attraction, sexual orientation, identity labels, relationship models, and, you know. Like. Everything.

It’s a big, wide Internet, here’s a few resources to get you started:

► Attraction (Sexual, Romantic, Sensual, Aesthetic) on AVENwiki
► Romantic Orientation (including Romantic identities) on Wikipedia
► What Are Different Types Of Attraction? on BetterHelp
► Untangling a Gender, Attraction and Relationships Tangle on Scarleteen
► Hey Hot Stuff: On Attraction, Desirability, and “Types” on Scarleteen
► Just the Basics, Ace: An Asexuality Primer on Scarleteen

ALSO. This point didn’t make it into the comic, but it’s the first example I bring up when I hear about someone’s bi/pan/queer sexuality being dismissed because they don’t have equal experience with the various genders:

When a virgin cisgender teenage boy who’s never even asked a girl out yet says that he’s straight, nobody’s like “You haven’t been with a girl yet, so I don’t really believe you. You’re confused or you want attention or you want to fit in with the cool kids or you just don’t even know what you actually want.” No! They’re just like “Ok.” and they don’t give it a second thought.

And yet, when people say they are attracted to more than one gender but they haven’t had any experience with those other types of folks, it’s fairly common they’ll get that incredulous, dismissive reaction– even from other members under the queer umbrella. There’s this air of “Prove it.” from the monosexuals.

Which is a long way of saying: If folks are willing to take a self-proclaimed straight boy at his word that he’s attracted to girls even if he has no experience with them, it’d be super cool if people would extend that courtesy of belief to all the inexperienced queer population too.

Which was still a long way of saying: DUDE, JUST BE COOL ABOUT BISEXUALS!

Project Spotlight:


Ok, not so much a “Project” but 8 POC Sex Educators You Should Be Following On Instagram is a great introduction to eight educators of color who are talking about sex, sexuality, bodies, self care, and more on their Instagram accounts. Follow for the beautiful photos, stay for the smart insights and nurturing words.

└ Tags: Ace, asexual, Attraction, Bisexual, education, interests, labels, pansexual, queer, sexual, sexuality, straight

item.title: I Don’t Want To Be Strong by Rado
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: One of the liberating aspects of sex is that it can be used to safely explore a side of a person that they can’t share in public. It could be a mousy librarian who becomes a confident dominatrix in bed, or the big, mean CEO who wants to be submissive and humiliated, or a big-hearted, […]
item.content:encoded:
I Don’t Want To Be Strong by Rado

by Matthew Nolan on 06/30/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics

One of the liberating aspects of sex is that it can be used to safely explore a side of a person that they can’t share in public. It could be a mousy librarian who becomes a confident dominatrix in bed, or the big, mean CEO who wants to be submissive and humiliated, or a big-hearted, nurturing, empathic person who wants to inflict some (consensual, wanted) pain, or– as in this week’s comic– the powerful superhero who wants to be the weak one, the protected one. We hope you like this tender piece by Rado and I’d encourage you to go check out the rest of his stuff. I believe he’s even our first artist from Madagascar!

  • Twitter
  • Handrava (webcomic)

Project Spotlight:


The Black Resilience Fund is helping Black Portlanders who need a little extra hand to pay their bills, pay for childcare, or just pay for a hot meal. The donations are going straight into our community and having an immediate impact on our neighbors ♥️

Lucy Bellwood is sending out a beautiful, gold-foiled art print to anyone who sends her a receipt of their donation to the BRS, take her up on it!

Reminder that I'm mailing prints to anyone who donates to @blackresiliency and sends me a receipt! I've mailed 57 packages so far to folks who have collectively contributed $4,120 which is AMAZING. Keep it going, y'all. https://t.co/O7qrQmZDQH pic.twitter.com/NYyeGViBlA

— Lucy Bellwood (@LuBellWoo) June 18, 2020

Erika and I are experiencing some serious burnout at the moment and are tossing around the idea of taking a real week off soon. You’d think that making a webcomic would allow you the flexibility to take as much time as you want off – but the reality of things are so different. I think the last time we officially took a week was back in December? We had a booked-in break just prior to quarantine times and rather than take the time off anyway, we just didn’t stop working 0_0 Next week, a comic on attraction and then maybe we’ll take a break!

We hope you’re all staying as well and strong as you can. Keep the hope alive, and keep doing what you can.

└ Tags: guest, guest comic, hero, petitradou, porn, pornography, Rado, superhero

by Matthew Nolan on 06/23/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics »

Edit later in the day: Re-worded a handful of sentences in the intro, for clarity!
Edit 6/25/20: The comic still isn’t sitting well with us. So we’ve removed an early panel. We might make another edit or two in the future as we reach out to others and hammer it out.

Feeling a little worn this past couple of weeks! But moving forever onward.

Can’t be too blue – we had the pleasure of getting a We-Vibe Wand in the mail and, after a bit of confusion, fell IN LOVE with it. Damn, do these guys make good toys or what.

item.title: Hentai Comics 101 by Christine Wong
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Have you done your activism today? Don’t worry, just drop a couple bucks over to the NAACP Legal Defense Fund real fast if you can, and if you can’t, here’s a nice lil’ reading resource list to get you started if you need a gentle nudge ♥️ Right! On to the comic info! Christine Wong […]
item.content:encoded:
Hentai Comics 101 by Christine Wong

by Matthew Nolan on 06/16/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Literature

Have you done your activism today? Don’t worry, just drop a couple bucks over to the NAACP Legal Defense Fund real fast if you can, and if you can’t, here’s a nice lil’ reading resource list to get you started if you need a gentle nudge ♥️ Right! On to the comic info!

Christine Wong first came across my radar when she was a mentee at Erika’s comic studio, Helioscope. She now lives and teaches in Japan, which she documents in delightful little autobio comics over on her social media accounts. Honestly, it was fun putting this one together and getting walked through a lil Japanese comic store!

Go drop her a hello!

  • Portfolio
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

As always we’re posting comics and trying to do our best, even in these difficult times. If you’ve not been to the site for a while, I’d totally recommend looking at the last handful of guest comics. While we’ve been stepping back for a breather, they’ve been stepping up. Every so often I lose an hour before bed re-reading these strips =D

Finally ZERO pressure, but today is the last day or so in our book’s Kickstarter. Give it a click and consider supporting what we do so we can keep hiring cartoonists like Christine.

└ Tags: christine wong, doujinshi, f4u, fakku, gujira, hentai, homunculus, hyocorou, ikuhana niiro, intimate days, japan, melty kiss, napata

item.title: Our Quarantine Protocols
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: This weeks a bit of a departure from the norm. See, we started work on an education comic a few weeks ago, then realized half-way through our work-week that it was NOT up to snuff. We we threw this little thing together. It’s not perfect, it’s NOT a rule set or a vetted guide, and, […]
item.content:encoded:
Our Quarantine Protocols

by Erika Moen on 06/09/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic

This weeks a bit of a departure from the norm. See, we started work on an education comic a few weeks ago, then realized half-way through our work-week that it was NOT up to snuff. We we threw this little thing together. It’s not perfect, it’s NOT a rule set or a vetted guide, and, heck, half the things in here probably aren’t actually useful. Who knows? If you’re looking for a better guide, look to the CDC.

While we’ve had this particular comic loaded in our update reservoir, the United States (and some of the world) has been going through a huge important movement – Black Lives Matter. People are protesting and shouting out against the racial inequalities baked into the American system. We absolutely support this cause and the protestors, and behind the scenes we’re doing our part to show up (while maintaining a social distance), donate money, read, and participate in all the ways that we’re capable of doing. From the last post, here are some resources for folks to check out Black Lives Matter, Ways to Help, Educate Yourself, 43 Bail Funds You Can Absolutely Support Right Now, and Understanding and Dismantling Racism: A Booklist for White Readers (Remember, you can borrow these books from your library for free!). And here are some new ones, just for this post! Anti-Racism: Actionable Steps, Abolish the Police? But How Would We Stay Safe?, A Guide to White Privilege, Defunding the Police Means Re-Funding Social Services, and White People: We gotta talk about burnout.

Look after yourselves and those around you.

…If you’ve made it down this far, our next book’s pre-order Kickstarter wraps up in 8 days. We’ve decided not to promote our comics or Kickstarter on social media during these times because there are more important things going on. But, if you’re here on our site at the bottom of this blog post, well, that’s where we’re mentioning it /:)

└ Tags: clean, corona, covid covid19, covid-19, disinfect, quarantine, sterile, virus

item.title: Dilating After by Naomi Rubin
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Before we get to our regularly scheduled blog post, we just want to share a few resources with people who support the protestors and Black Lives Matter: Ways to Help, Educate Yourself, 43 Bail Funds You Can Absolutely Support Right Now, and Understanding and Dismantling Racism: A Booklist for White Readers (Remember, you can borrow […]
item.content:encoded:
Dilating After by Naomi Rubin

by Matthew Nolan on 06/02/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Health

Before we get to our regularly scheduled blog post, we just want to share a few resources with people who support the protestors and Black Lives Matter: Ways to Help, Educate Yourself, 43 Bail Funds You Can Absolutely Support Right Now, and Understanding and Dismantling Racism: A Booklist for White Readers (Remember, you can borrow these books from your library for free!). And for those who feel overwhelmed by everything and all the different calls to action, Erika found this quote especially helpful:

Do NOT feel guilty for not occupying every lane. We need all of them.
—Lindss_tatic

Resistance is NOT a one lane highway. Maybe your lane is protesting, maybe your lane is organizing, maybe your lane is counseling, maybe your lane is art activism, maybe your lane is surviving the day.


And now, on to our post to go with today’s comic…

We’re super honored to have Naomi Rubin share this vulnerable and personal slice of life with us today! She hit it out of the park with this comic that’s both educational and personal, while standing on its own as just a beautiful piece of art. It is such an honor to showcase her work!

Go say hi to Naomi or even better yet, be awesome and drop her a dollar or two on Patreon! Although, Naomi’s requested that if your feeling generous, to consider putting your money elsewhere: Black Visions Collective & Bail Fund Sites.

  • Patreon
  • Moonsprout (Webcomic)
  • Instagram
  • Twitter
  • InPRNT Shop
  • Etsy

The world is on fire and there are plenty of links above that deserve your money, but also if you are on the lookout for a book about sexual health, well, our Kickstarter is half-way through. Drawn to Sex Book 2: Our Bodies and Health. These pre-orders keep Oh Joy Sex Toy running and able to hire guest artists like Naomi ♥️


Again – stay safe out there. Look after yourselves and those around you <3

└ Tags: autobio, dilation, dilator, dilators, education, gender affirming, genital, genitals, guest, guest comic, Naomi Rubin, surgery, vagina, vaginoplasty, vulva

item.content:encoded:
Satisfyer Plug Set

by Matthew Nolan on 05/26/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Anal Toys »
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics

I’ve been known to enjoy a good plug or two and, lord knows, I love a deal, so combine the two? I’m in heaven! Satisfyer’s up in here satisfying my butt AND my wallet.

Sure, sure – I DO think there are better butt toys out there (Snug plugs and Njoys for example) and from what I could see, these aren’t widely stocked. But that doesn’t mean I don’t think they are good. I keep being impressed by Satifyer’s stuff. I hope you are too!

Buy it from one of our Friends (With Benefits)

item.title: Pre-Order Drawn to Sex: Our Bodies and Health!
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Pre-Order Book Here Yessss it’s ready for pre-orders! Reserve your copy now for a November 2020 delivery! Pre-Order Here Drawn to Sex is our series of books collecting just the educational comics from Oh Joy Sex Toy. While The Basics, our first book in this line, was all about, y’know, the basics of doin’ it, […]
item.content:encoded:
Pre-Order Drawn to Sex: Our Bodies and Health!

by Erika Moen on 05/21/2020 at 12:54 pm
Posted In: Blog

Pre-Order Book Here



Yessss it’s ready for pre-orders! Reserve your copy now for a November 2020 delivery!

Pre-Order Here

Drawn to Sex is our series of books collecting just the educational comics from Oh Joy Sex Toy. While The Basics, our first book in this line, was all about, y’know, the basics of doin’ it, THIS sequel, Our Bodies and Health, focuses on the science-y, biology-y side of things.

Subjects covered range from genital construction to pregnancy to abortion to STIs to the various ways your reproductive organs can go haywire on you and what you can do to deal with it all. This collection of positive, compassionate comics is designed to help the reader learn about difficult topics without shame or judgement, and squeeze in a dad joke here and there.

All the pre-orders through Kickstarter not only help us deliver the finished book to our backers, but also directly funds the Oh Joy Sex Toy project and enables us to hire the dozens of talented guest cartoonists we feature each year. It’s kind of a fundraiser for our sex positive comic operation overall.

Our Kickstarter is also the only place where you can get signed or sketch-in copies, or an original drawing! My normal work schedule doesn’t leave me time to take take on freelance art jobs, but this is the one time of the year I make an exception, so take advantage of it!

Thank you so much! Now…

Pre-Order Book Here

└ Tags: book, drawn to sex, kickstarter, pre-order

item.content:encoded:
Lucky Devil Eats

by Erika Moen on 05/12/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Porn & Websites

Enticed? Just head on over to the Lucky Devil Eats website to place your order and then drive on down to

Lucky Devil Lounge
633 SE Powell Blvd
Portland, OR 97266

I recommend the chicken strips. And the two inches of flat 7-up.

The dancers featured in our comic are Alex, Poni, Toxic, Olivia, Reign, and Elle!

Sex Work and COVID-19

“Typically, exotic dancers are classified as independent contractors, meaning they don’t have paid sick leave or other benefits should they find themselves out of work. As a result, following club shutdowns, like many service-industry workers throughout the United States, dancers have been left totally bereft of income.”
With Clubs Closed for COVID-19, Strippers in Portland, Oregon, Take to Topless Food Delivery

► Excluding those in the sex industry from covid-19 relief is a mistake on The Washington Post

► Here’s How You Can Help Sex Workers During the COVID-19 Outbreak on ReWire

► Sex workers are falling through the cracks in coronavirus assistance programs around the world on The Washington Post

► ‘Don’t have to fight for pennies’: New Zealand safety net helps sex workers in lockdown on The Guardian

► Emergency Relief Sex Worker Fundraiser Compilations here and on Twitter

└ Tags: adventure, autobio, Boober, delivery, Food, Lucky Devil Eats, lucky devil lounge, review, sex work, sex worker, strip club, strip joint, stripper, strippers

item.title: Quarantine with Matt and Erika
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Bit of a short update. Erika and I are on our 5th… 6th…? week of quarantine and the mood keeps fluctuating. When we sat down this week to come up with a comic, we both felt… drained. Or sober… maybe reflective – I’m not sure what the right word is for what we’re all feeling […]
item.content:encoded:
Quarantine with Matt and Erika

by Matthew Nolan on 04/28/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic

Bit of a short update. Erika and I are on our 5th… 6th…? week of quarantine and the mood keeps fluctuating. When we sat down this week to come up with a comic, we both felt… drained. Or sober… maybe reflective – I’m not sure what the right word is for what we’re all feeling right now. Regardless, we decided to do a little bit of autobio instead of our usual fare.

This is us. This is our day-to-day during the pandemic.

While our work life hasn’t changed that much, we did have to postpone the Kickstarter for our next Drawn to Sex book, which was a big bummer but necessary. We’re looking forwarding to launching it this May, though!

We hope the comic finds you healthy and doing well! We can do this, all of us. <3 Love to you and yours.

└ Tags: autobio, baking, covid-19, pandemic, quarantine, rowing
